WorkItem.Description:
Example: 
NCalc.Expression exp = new NCalc.Expression("3735928559"); // 0xDEADBEEF 
object resultvar = exp.Evaluate();
console.writeline(resultvar.ToString()); // 3.73592858E+9 

Result is 3.73592858E+9 which is != 0xDEADBEEF. The resultvar is also of type System.Single.

Any idea how we can suppress this conversion and get 0xDEADBEEF as the result?
WorkItem.Summary: Converting an integer to float/double unnecessarily
